intro: ^! Getting a few more books out? Aren't you at the limit by now?"

s: ^Hi Lila! I'm definitely over the 25 book limit, but I'm looking for some activities, so-
^Now you know, I'm over the limit. But like you, I'm trying to find some cool things for kids.

Chat1: ^Lila?Smiling "Oh? I love making up new activities. Is this for the Block Party? The child care area is going to be great, I think."

s: ^It is for the Block Party. I'm trying to make sure it's inclusive for everyone, so I'm looking for some ideas.
^If you've got a minute, I could actually use your help.

Chat2: ^Lila?Smiling "Well, I'm happy to help if you need it. The students in my class are all different, and have different needs. I could probably help you."

s: ^That's really great to hear, Lila. You're a lifesaver.
^Thanks so much, Lila. I just want to make this the best time for all the families, you know?

Explain1: ^Lila?Smiling "Helping out like this is important in any community. So, I'm totally willing to give you ideas, or advice. What's up?"

s: ^I want to make sure the Block Party is still fun for children with sensory processing issues.
^Some children get overwhelmed with loud places. So I want to make sure the Block Party is still fun.

Explain2: ^Lila?Neutral "That's really valid. Children with autism or ADHD can sometimes feel overwhelmed in loud spaces like the Block Party."
^Lila?Neutral "Adults too. Having some different options could help everyone have a good time."

s: ^I think so too. Do you know what some good activities for children and families with these issues might be?
^I think so too. Do you have any tips?

Suggestion1: ^Lila_Day 4_A calm sensory activity can help all children to regulate their emotions_Mrcalindas4

Suggestion1.#: notification Lila_Day 4_A calm sensory activity can help all children to regulate their emotions_Mrcalindas4

Suggestion1: ^Lila_Day 4_Avoid judging or blaming the child for feeling overstimulated_Mrcalindas4

Suggestion1.#: notification Lila_Day 4_Avoid judging or blaming the child for feeling overstimulated_Mrcalindas4

Suggestion1: ^Lila?Smiling "Creating smaller quieter activities can really help."
^Lila?Smiling "One thing we can do is have a smaller sensory activity like making slime in bags so that children can take a break from the bounce house."
^Lila?Smiling "Also, we can all avoid making children feel bad about themselves for feeling overstimulated. It's not their fault, and they aren't misbehaving. We all process things differently."

s: ^I never thought about it like that. Do you have any other ideas?
^Wow Lila, you always know just how to handle things like this. Thank you!

Suggestion2: ^Lila_Day 4_There's a quiet corner in the children's area

Suggestion2.#: notification Lila_Day 4_There's a quiet corner in the children's area

Suggestion2: ^Lila?Smiling "Well, one thing we do have is a quiet book corner in the children's area. Kids can draw or color and relax in beanbags."

s: ^Hmm. That sounds like a great start. Is there anything else you can think of doing?
^Oh! It's great you already thought of this. Thanks Lila!

Goodbye: ^. Helping all families feel welcome and wanted in Bloomwood is the least we can do, right?"
^Lila?Smiling "I love working together to make it happen. I think I'm going to see if I can pick up some materials for our sensory bags. See you soon, okay?"

s: ^Thanks you for your insight, Lila. You're a lifesaver, see you.
^See you Lila! Thanks so much for always giving me such great ideas.
